title.narrative: West Africa Unique Identification for Regional Integration and Inclusion (WURI) Program

description.narrative: The Program Development Objective (Pr.DO) is to increase the number of persons in participating countries who have government-recognized proof of unique identity that facilitates access to services.The Project Development Objective (PDO) for Phase 1 of the Project is to increase the number of persons in Côte d’Ivoire and Guinea who have government-recognized proof of unique identity that facilitates access to services.

condition.narrative: 1. The Republic of Côte d'Ivoire and Republic of Guinea shall each adopt a Foundational ID System Law and its related regulations,and shall not, after such adoption, amend, suspend, abrogate, repeal, or waive the Foundational ID System Law and/or its relatedregulations in a way that materially and adversely affects the achievement of the objectives of the Project.

10. The Republic of Guinea shall, not later than 30th June 2021, designate or establish an independent agency to be responsible formatters of identity and Foundational ID Systems in form and mandate satisfactory to the Association.

11. The Republic of Côte d'Ivoire shall cause ONI, and the Republic of Guinea and the ECOWAS Commission shall, not later than two(2) months after the Effective Date, prepare and adopt a Project Implementation Manual in form and substance satisfactory to theAssociation.

12. The Republic of Côte d'Ivoire shall cause ONI not later than three (3) months, prepare and disclose a (i) Social Assessment andManagement Plan and (ii) Stakeholder Engagement Plan in form and substance satisfactory to the Association.

13. The Republic of Côte d'Ivoire shall cause ONI, and the Republic of Guinea shall, not later than three (3) months, establish andmaintain a grievance redress mechanism in form and substance satisfactory to the Association.

14. The Republic of Guinea shall, not later than three (3) months, prepare and disclose a social assessment and management plan andstakeholder engagement plan in form and substance satisfactory to the Association.

2. The Republic of Côte d'Ivoire shall cause ONI: not later than one (1) month, after the Effective Date, recruit, and thereaftermaintain, a senior social specialist; not later than two (2) months after the Effective Date, recruit, and thereafter maintain, anaccountant; not later than three (3) months after the Effective Date, recruit and, thereafter maintain: (i) an assistant financialmanagement officer; and (ii) a grievance redress mechanism assistant specialist; all with qualifications, and under terms ofreference, satisfactory to the Association.

3. The Republic of Guinea shall: not later than (1) one month after the Effective Date recruit, and thereafter maintain, a seniorsocial development specialist; not later than two (2) months after the Effective Date, recruit, and thereafter maintain: (i) afinancial management officer; (ii) an accountant; (iii) two procurement specialists; and (iv) a grievance redress mechanismassistant specialist; all with qualifications, and under terms of reference, satisfactory to the Association.

4. The ECOWAS Commission shall: not later than (1) one month after the Effective Date recruit, and thereafter maintain, anaccountant, with qualifications, and under Terms of Reference, satisfactory to the Association

5. The Republic of Côte d'Ivoire shall cause ONI, and the Republic of Guinea shall each, not later than two (2) months after theEffective Date, install and, thereafter maintain, an accounting software for the Project, in a manner acceptable to the Association.

6. The Republic of Côte d'Ivoire shall cause ONI, not later than four (4) months after the Effective Date, to recruit, andthereafter maintain, an external auditor, with qualifications and under Terms of Reference, satisfactory to the Association.

7. The Republic of Guinea shall, not later than five (5) months after the Effective Date, recruit and, thereafter maintain, anexternal auditor, with qualifications and under Terms of Reference satisfactory to the Association.

8. The Republic of Guinea shall, not later than three (3) months after the Effective Date, recruit and, thereafter maintain, aninternal auditor, with qualifications and under Terms of Reference satisfactory to the Association.

9. The Republic of Côte d'Ivoire shall cause ONI, and the Republic of Guinea shall, each, not later than six (6) months after theEffective Date, (to) recruit and maintain an independent third party with the responsibility of oversight of the use ofFoundational ID System, with qualifications and under terms of reference satisfactory to the Association.

title.narrative: Access to Services: Number of digital authentications made by functional users (by sector or service) per month on behalf of theirbeneficiaries or clients (of which % on behalf of women).
National or regional functional public and private services linked to the Foundational ID system
Percentage of newborns assigned UNIs during birth registration.
Percentage of grievances responded to and/or resolved within the stipulated service standards
Percentage of individuals in fID system whose biometric and demographic data meet international stds
Number of direct project beneficiaries who have received a UNI (of which women)
Development of fID system which generates UNIs, in keeping with international practices
Law for fID system created, establishing the system’s inclusivity for all persons in territory
Legal Robustness: Development of foundational ID system enabling legal and institutional frameworks in keeping with regional standards and international good practices.
The FID system is operational and ready for rollout
Citizen Engagement: Annual consultations held with beneficiaries and ID stakeholders and government to act on feedback received during consultations. - Disaggregated by marginalized group categories:
